definitions: plan and direct a complex operation or project using intelligence and strategic thinking
serve as the intellectual force behind an idea or organization
examples: She masterminded the entire marketing campaign brilliantly
The detective finally caught who masterminded the heist
Einstein masterminded revolutionary changes in modern physics
The CEO masterminded the company's global expansion strategy

definitions: become twisted or tangled together into a thick mass or knot
cover or furnish a surface with matting or similar material
examples: Her hair matted badly after swimming in the ocean
The wet fur matted together in thick clumps
They decided to mat the entire gymnasium floor
The artist matted the photograph before framing it

definitions: be equal to something in quality or strength or correspond exactly
put together things that are similar or belong together as pairs
compete against another person or team in a contest or game
examples: The paint color perfectly matches the carpet shade
Her skills match the job requirements very precisely
Can you match these socks into proper pairs?
The dating app matches people with similar interests
The champion will match against the challenger tonight
Our team matched their opponents goal for goal

definitions: come together for breeding or reproduction between male and female animals
bring together or join as a matching pair or partnership
examples: The birds mate every spring in this region
Lions typically mate multiple times during breeding season
The engineer mated the two components together perfectly
These puzzle pieces mate to form the picture

definitions: become actual fact or reality after being planned or expected
appear suddenly or unexpectedly as if from nowhere or thin air
examples: The promised funding never materialised despite repeated assurances
Her dreams finally materialised after years of hard work
A figure materialised from the shadows without warning
Help materialised just when we needed it most desperately

definitions: become actual fact or reality after being planned or expected
appear suddenly or unexpectedly as if from nowhere or thin air
examples: The promised investment never materialized after months waiting
Their plans finally materialized into a successful business
A solution materialized from our brainstorming session unexpectedly
The ghost seemed to materialize right before our eyes

definitions: make a surface dull or non-reflective by removing shine or gloss
examples: The photographer matted the prints for the exhibition
They decided to matte the paint for better appearance

definitions: become fully grown or developed physically mentally or emotionally over time
reach the date when a financial obligation becomes due for payment
examples: Children mature at different rates during their adolescence
The wine needs years to mature properly underground
The bond will mature in exactly five years time
Your investment matures next month with excellent returns

definitions: attack and injure someone or something by tearing scratching or crushing
handle or treat something roughly or carelessly causing damage or wear
examples: The bear mauled the hiker during the unexpected encounter
The dog mauled the intruder who entered the yard
The critics thoroughly mauled his latest theatrical performance
Years of use had mauled the old leather chair

definitions: talk in a rambling or aimless way without clear purpose or direction
move or act in a dreamy aimless way without definite purpose
examples: He maundered on about his childhood for hours endlessly
The professor maundered through topics without any clear structure
She maundered through the gardens on the sunny afternoon
The old man maundered around town with nowhere particular

definitions: increase something to the greatest possible amount size or degree
examples: The company wants to maximise profits this financial quarter
Athletes train hard to maximise their performance potential completely

definitions: increase something to the greatest possible amount size or degree
enlarge a computer window to fill the entire screen display
examples: We need to maximize efficiency in our production processes
The strategy aims to maximize shareholder value this year
Click the button to maximize the application window completely
Please maximize the browser for better viewing experience today

definitions: signify indicate or refer to a particular thing or notion
intend to convey or express a particular sense or message
have as a consequence or result leading to particular outcome
examples: The red light means you must stop your vehicle
What does this ancient symbol mean in their culture?
I meant to say hello but forgot completely yesterday
She didn't mean to hurt your feelings that way
This decision means we must change our entire strategy
Missing the deadline means losing the important contract completely

definitions: walk or move in a leisurely aimless way without hurry or purpose
follow a winding or intricate course like a river or path
examples: We meandered through the old town exploring interesting shops
The tourists meandered along the beach collecting pretty shells
The river meanders through the valley for several miles
The hiking trail meanders up the mountainside quite gradually

definitions: determine the size amount or degree of something using instruments or units
assess the importance or value of something by comparing against standards
carefully consider and take action with deliberate restraint or calculation
examples: The carpenter measured the wood before cutting it precisely
Scientists measure temperature changes in the Arctic region regularly
We need to measure success by customer satisfaction levels
How do you measure the value of artistic expression?
The government measured its response to avoid causing panic
She measured her words carefully during the tense negotiation

definitions: interfere in something that is not one's concern often in annoying way
examples: Stop meddling in other people's personal business constantly
The neighbors always meddle in everyone else's private affairs

definitions: intervene between parties in a dispute to help them reach agreement
act as an intermediary or means of conveying something between parties
examples: The counselor mediated between the divorcing couple quite successfully
The UN will mediate the peace talks next month
Hormones mediate many important bodily functions and processes daily
The software mediates communication between different computer systems effectively

definitions: treat a person or animal with medicine to cure illness or injury
examples: The veterinarian medicined the sick horse through the night
They medicined the patient with the latest antibiotics available

definitions: think deeply and carefully about something for extended period of time
focus one's mind for spiritual purposes or relaxation using special techniques
examples: She meditated on the meaning of life for hours
The philosopher meditated deeply about the nature of reality
He meditates every morning for thirty minutes before work
Buddhist monks meditate to achieve inner peace and enlightenment

definitions: come together with another person either by chance or arrangement
fulfill or satisfy requirements conditions or needs successfully and completely
come into contact or connection with something at a point
examples: Let's meet at the coffee shop tomorrow afternoon promptly
I met an old friend unexpectedly at the store
The product meets all international safety standards and regulations
She meets every challenge with determination and creative thinking
The two rivers meet at the base of the mountain
Where the ocean meets the sky on the horizon

definitions: blend or combine things together to form a single unified entity
examples: The flavors meld together beautifully in this exotic dish
Different cultures melded to create the unique neighborhood character

definitions: become soft sweet and mature especially through aging or ripening process
make or become less harsh severe or strict in manner or attitude
examples: The wine mellowed beautifully after aging ten years underground
The cheese mellows as it ages in the cave
He really mellowed after becoming a grandfather last year
Years of experience mellowed her strict teaching style considerably

definitions: change from solid to liquid state by heating or warming temperature
gradually disappear or disperse until completely gone from sight or existence
become tender gentle or emotionally moved losing hardness or resistance
examples: The ice cream melted quickly in the summer heat
Gold melts at extremely high temperatures exceeding thousand degrees
The crowd melted away when police arrived on scene
Her anger melted as she heard the full explanation
His heart melted when he saw the puppy playing
She melted into his arms during their emotional reunion

definitions: preserve the memory of someone or something through monument ceremony or record
examples: The statue memorializes soldiers who died defending the country
They memorialized her contributions with a special scholarship fund

definitions: commit information to memory through deliberate learning and repetition practice
examples: Students must memorize all the irregular verbs by Friday
She memorized her entire speech for the important presentation

definitions: threaten or be a source of danger harm or evil to someone
examples: The storm menaced coastal communities for three days straight
Gang violence menaces the neighborhood making residents fearful daily

definitions: repair something that is broken or damaged to make it functional
improve or recover from injury illness or difficult situation gradually
examples: She mended the torn dress with careful tiny stitches
Can you mend this broken chair leg before dinner?
The broken bone will mend in about six weeks
They're trying to mend their relationship after the argument

definitions: refer to something or someone briefly without discussing in detail
examples: She mentioned your name during our conversation yesterday evening
The report mentions several important environmental concerns worth considering

definitions: guide teach and help someone less experienced especially in professional development
examples: She mentors young entrepreneurs starting their first business ventures
The professor mentored him throughout his doctoral research program

definitions: make the characteristic crying sound of a cat or kitten
examples: The hungry cat meowed loudly outside the kitchen door
Kittens meow constantly when they want their mother's attention

definitions: promote advertise and sell goods or products commercially in organized fashion
examples: The company merchandises its products through multiple retail channels
They merchandise seasonal items very aggressively before major holidays

definitions: combine or cause to combine to form a single unified entity
blend into traffic when two lanes become one on road
examples: The two companies will merge to form a larger corporation
Several small streams merge into one mighty river here
Traffic must merge carefully when entering the busy highway
Please merge left as the right lane ends ahead

definitions: deserve or be worthy of something especially reward praise or attention
examples: Her excellent work merits a substantial salary increase immediately
This proposal merits serious consideration from the entire board

definitions: fit together or work well together in harmonious effective combination
engage or cause gear teeth to engage with another gear
examples: Their different skills mesh perfectly for this complex project
The new policy doesn't mesh with existing company procedures
Make sure the gears mesh properly before starting the machine
The transmission gears failed to mesh causing mechanical problems

definitions: send a message to someone especially using electronic communication methods
examples: Please message me when you arrive at the airport
She messages her friends constantly throughout the entire day

definitions: process substances through chemical changes in living organisms for energy or growth
examples: The liver metabolizes drugs and toxins from the bloodstream
Your body metabolizes food more slowly as you age

definitions: cover or coat something with metal material for protection or decoration
examples: They decided to metal the roof for better durability
The artist metals sculptures to create unique textured surfaces

definitions: measure or regulate something using a metering device or systematic measurement
examples: The utility company meters electricity usage every month precisely
They meter the flow rate to ensure consistent water pressure

definitions: make a soft high crying sound like a cat or seagull
confine or shut up in a restricted space like a cage
examples: The seagulls mewed overhead as they circled the fishing boats
The kitten mewed pitifully when left alone at night
They mewed the hawks in cages before the hunt
The prisoners were mewed up in tiny cramped cells

definitions: photograph and reproduce documents or images on microfilm for storage preservation
examples: The library microfilmed all historical newspapers for permanent preservation
They microfilm important documents to save valuable storage space

definitions: cook or heat food using electromagnetic waves in a microwave oven
examples: She microwaved the leftovers for a quick dinner tonight
Don't microwave metal containers as they could spark dangerously

definitions: place or position something in the middle or center of something
examples: She middled the picture perfectly on the living room wall
The designer middled the text on the promotional poster carefully

definitions: move from one region or habitat to another especially seasonally
transfer data or systems from one computing environment to another
examples: Birds migrate south every winter seeking warmer weather conditions
Many workers migrate to cities for better employment opportunities
We need to migrate our database to the new server
The company will migrate all systems to cloud storage

definitions: become affected or covered with mildew fungus in damp conditions
examples: The bathroom curtains mildewed from constant moisture and humidity
Books will mildew if stored in damp basement areas

definitions: draw milk from a cow or other animal by hand or machine
exploit or take advantage of something to gain maximum benefit unfairly
examples: The farmer milks the cows twice every single day
They still milk goats by hand in rural villages
He milked the situation for all possible financial advantage
Don't milk the joke too much or it becomes unfunny

definitions: grind grain or other material into powder or fine particles
move around in a confused mass or crowd without clear direction
examples: They mill wheat into flour at the old windmill
The coffee shop mills fresh beans every morning precisely
People milled around the entrance waiting for doors to open
Cattle mill nervously before an approaching thunderstorm arrives suddenly

definitions: act out a story or emotion using only gestures without words
examples: The performer mimed climbing an invisible ladder quite convincingly
She mimed eating to show she was hungry for lunch

definitions: imitate someone's actions speech or mannerisms especially to entertain or mock
examples: Children often mimic their parents' behavior and speech patterns
The comedian brilliantly mimics famous politicians during his performances

definitions: cut food especially meat into very small pieces with knife or machine
walk with short quick steps in an affected or delicate manner
examples: Please mince the garlic before adding it to the sauce
The recipe requires you to mince the beef very finely
She minced across the room in her expensive high heels
He minced his way through the crowd quite pretentiously yesterday

definitions: feel concern objection or annoyance about something or someone's actions
pay attention to or take notice of something important or dangerous
look after or take care of someone or something temporarily
examples: I don't mind waiting a few extra minutes here
Would you mind opening the window for fresh air?
Mind the gap when boarding the underground train please
You should mind your manners at the formal dinner
Can you mind the baby while I go shopping?
She minds the store when the owner takes vacation
